cw3

Class Elevator

  • java.lang.Object
    • cw3.Elevator

  • public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object

    This class denotes an American-style elevator (no 13th floor) with two strategies:

    • Default strategy: Start at the bottom, go to the top and then back to the bottom.
    • Improved strategy: Start from current position and direction; change direction when finished serving customers in that direction; and only go as far as necessary.
    These two methods (the strategies) return the number of moves it took them to serve all customers.

    This class is used by the AppDriver class to simulate elevator operation.

    Since:
    10th November 2014
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Liran Harary & Shay Meshulam

      Elevator(int numFloors, int bottomFloor, java.util.ArrayList<Customer> customerList)
      Takes as arguments: number of floors, bottom floor and a Customer list. Sets the bottomFloor, numFloors, currentFloor and customerList. Infers and sets the topFloor.

      int startElevatorDefaultStrategy()
      Starts this elevator at default strategy: Starts at the bottom floor. Goes to the top floor. Goes back down to the bottom floor. Picks up and drops off customers according to the data in customerList, using the methods pickUpCustomers() and dropOffCustomers(), respectively. Once finished, this method returns the total amount of moves this elevator has done.
      int startElevatorImprovedStrategy()
      Starts the elevator at improved strategy: Starts at the current floor (This saves the elevator a trip to the bottom floor, if a second run was needed (and implemented). Only goes as high as necessary on the way up, and as low as necessary on the way down, using the methods: unservedCustomersRemain() and customersWaitingInDirection() to determine whether to keep moving / change direction / stop. Picks up and drops off customers according to the data in customerList, using the methods pickUpCustomers() and dropOffCustomers(), respectively. Once finished, this method returns the total amount of moves this elevator has done.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a summary of this elevator's properties in a readable format.
      private boolean unservedCustomersRemain()
      Iterates through customerList and returns true if any customer is not finished (isFinished == false), and false if all customers are finished.

      • getNumFloors

        public int getNumFloors()

        Returns:
        numFloors

      • setNumFloorsAndTopFloor

        private void setNumFloorsAndTopFloor(int numFloors)
        Takes the number of floors as an argument and sets numFloors to its value. It thereafter infers and sets the topFloor value by the values of numFloors and bottomFloor.

        Prints an error message if numFloors is smaller than 2.

        Parameters:
        numFloors - Number of floors the elevator serves

      • getRegisterList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Customer> getRegisterList()
        Returns this elevator's register list - the list of customers who are currently in the elevator.
        Returns:
        registerList

      • setCurrentFloor

        public void setCurrentFloor(int currentFloor)
        Sets this elevator's currentFloor.

        Prints error message if currentFloor parameter is not between the bottomFloor and topFloor.

        Parameters:

      • printlnIfAnnotationsOn

        private void printlnIfAnnotationsOn(java.lang.String printStr)
        Prints the parameter only if annotations are turned on (i.e. true).
        Parameters:
        printStr - The String to print

      • setAllCustomersToNotFinished

        public void setAllCustomersToNotFinished()
        Iterates through customerList, setting each Customer's "finished" attribute to false (via the Customer's setFinished method).

      • startElevatorDefaultStrategy

        public int startElevatorDefaultStrategy()
        Starts this elevator at default strategy:
        • Starts at the bottom floor.
        • Goes to the top floor.
        • Goes back down to the bottom floor.
        • Picks up and drops off customers according to the data in customerList, using the methods pickUpCustomers() and dropOffCustomers(), respectively.
        Once finished, this method returns the total amount of moves this elevator has done.
        Returns:
        movesCounter

      • startElevatorImprovedStrategy

        public int startElevatorImprovedStrategy()
        Starts the elevator at improved strategy:
        • Starts at the current floor (This saves the elevator a trip to the bottom floor, if a second run was needed (and implemented).
        • Only goes as high as necessary on the way up, and as low as necessary on the way down, using the methods: unservedCustomersRemain() and customersWaitingInDirection() to determine whether to keep moving / change direction / stop.
        • Picks up and drops off customers according to the data in customerList, using the methods pickUpCustomers() and dropOffCustomers(), respectively.
        Once finished, this method returns the total amount of moves this elevator has done.
        Returns:
        movesCounter

      • unservedCustomersRemain

        private boolean unservedCustomersRemain()
        Iterates through customerList and returns true if any customer is not finished (isFinished == false), and false if all customers are finished.
        Returns:
        whether or not unserved customers remain

      • dropOffCustomers

        private void dropOffCustomers()
        Checks if any Customers in the elevator need to be dropped off at the current floor.

        Iterates through registerList and does the following for each customer with the same destination floor as the current floor:

        • Prints a message saying which customer got dropped off, if annotations are turned on.
        • Invokes the customerLeaves(Customer) method with the Customer object sent as an argument.

      • pickUpCustomers

        private void pickUpCustomers()
        Checks if any Customers need to be picked up at the current floor.

        Iterates through customerList and looks for Customers who are:

        • not finished, AND
        • not in this elevator, AND
        • are on the same floor as this elevator, AND
        • the Customer wants to go in the same direction as this elevator's.
        For any such Customer, the method:
        • Prints a message saying which customer got picked up, if annotations are turned on.
        • Calls the customerJoins(Customer) method with the Customer object sent as an argument.

      • customerJoins

        private void customerJoins(Customer customer)
        Invoked when it has been determined that a Customer should join the elevator.

        Takes a Customer object and does 2 things:

        • Sets the Customer's inElevator property to true.
        • Adds the Customer to the registerList.
        Parameters:
        customer - The Customer object in question

      • customerLeaves

        private void customerLeaves(Customer customer)
        Invoked when it has been determined that a Customer should leave the elevator.

        It takes a Customer object and does 3 things:

        • Sets the Customer's inElevator property to false.
        • Sets the Customer's isFinished property to true.
        • Removes the Customer from the registerList.
        Parameters:
        customer - The Customer object in question

      • customersWaitingInDirection

        private boolean customersWaitingInDirection()
        Returns true if there are Customers waiting in this elevator's direction, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        whether or not any customers are waiting in this elevator's direction.

      • changeDirection

        private void changeDirection()
        Changes this elevator's direction to its opposite if it's "up" or "down", and prints and error otherwise.

        Upon changing the direction, if annotations are turned on, it prints a message saying what direction it changed it to.

      • printCustomersInElevatorIfAnnotationsOn

        private void printCustomersInElevatorIfAnnotationsOn()
        If annotations are turned on, iterates through the registerList and prints all Customers within it.

      • move

        private void move()
        Moves the elevator once in its direction. If after the move the elevator is at floor 13, this method will move the elevator again.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a summary of this elevator's properties in a readable format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        objString
